name: Idiopathic Trigeminal Neuralgia with Vascular Compression
chief_complaint: I get sudden, sharp, electric shock-like pain on one side of my face
symptoms: pain triggered by light touch or chewing

lab_results.MRI: neurovascular compression of trigeminal nerve root

treatment: microvascular decompression surgery if medication fails
prognosis: good with treatment, though may require long-term management
description: A neuropathic pain disorder affecting the trigeminal nerve, characterized by sudden, severe, brief, stabbing recurrent pains in one or more branches of the nerve. Often caused by vascular compression at the nerve root entry zone.
multiple_choice: Idiopathic Trigeminal Neuralgia with Vascular Compression
